      void drawBoard()
      This method draws the board If the X and Y is equal to 1 there is a living cell.
      void drawGrid()
      This method draws the grid of the board.
      void expandBehind(int x, int y)
      this method expands the dynamic board by adding cells behind the given cell (due to a lack of time we couldn't finish making the board dynamic.)
      void expandBelow(int i, int j)
      this method expands the board with two cells south-east from the given cell point.
      void expandUpper(int i, int j)
      this method expands the board with two cells north-west from the given cell point (due to a lack of time we couldn't finish making the board dynamic.)

      helping method for the Class DynamicBoardTest, to check if the dynamic board is working
      int neighbours(int x, int y)
      This method counts the number of neighbouring cells a given cell has, by iterating through the board with two for-loops that only checks the 8 cells surrounding it.

      this method updates the board by applying the GoL rules to the board.
      void nextGenerationConcurrent()
      this method splits the nextGeneration method into several tasks that are given to multiple threads, optimalize the performance.

      this method prints out the performance of the nextGeneration(); method.

      This method updates the board by applying the GoL rules, by iterating through the board with two for-loops and assigning 1 or 0 using the GoL rules.

    • Method Detail

      • sizeChange

        public void sizeChange()
        This method is connected to a slider. Allows the user to select size to the board and drawn cells. The method sets the new size to cellSize, gc clears the board, then draw() is executed. And draws everything to the screen.
        Overrides:
        sizeChange in class Board

      • setCellState

        public void setCellState(int x,
                         int y)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method makes a given cell alive (changing the value to 1) overridden to fit the dynamic board
        Overrides:
        setCellState in class Board
        Parameters:
        x - and y variables that tells us where the cell is on the board
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getCellState

        public int getCellState(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Byte>> b,
                        int x,
                        int y)
        this method returns a cells state (if its dead or alive)
        Parameters:
        x - and y variables that tells us where in the list the cell is and a 2D arraylist of the board

      • getCellStateTest

        public int getCellStateTest(int x,
                            int y)
        helping method for the Class DynamicBoardTest, to check if the dynamic board is working
        Parameters:
        x - and y coordinates for the given cell
        Returns:
        0 if the cell is dead, and 1 if the cell is alive

      • drawGrid

        public void drawGrid()
        This method draws the grid of the board. for-loops for X and Y, which adds the size of the cell each iterate to the grid according to the height and width of the Canvas.
        Overrides:
        drawGrid in class Board

      • draw

        public void draw()
        This is a "helping-method" which contains two main draw-methods. drawGrid draws the grid of the board. drawBoard draws the board's array.
        Overrides:
        draw in class Board

      • drawBoard

        public void drawBoard()
        This method draws the board If the X and Y is equal to 1 there is a living cell. overrides the method in Board to fit the dynamic board
        Overrides:
        drawBoard in class Board
        Parameters:
        i - is point to X axis
        j - is point to Y axis

      • getCellSize

        public int getCellSize()
        returns the variable cellsSize
        Overrides:
        getCellSize in class Board
        Returns:
        cellSize

      • clearBoard

        public void clearBoard()
        This method clears the current Board Clears the board first. Then a for-loop that search board for any living cells if true, then set that coordinate [x][y] equal to 0 Draw grid again and stop the Animation. overrides the method in Board to fit the dynamic board
        Overrides:
        clearBoard in class Board

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(byte[][] gameBoard)
        this metohd converts a given static 2d board into a dynamic Arraylist. the static array has information about what cells are alive and which are not, which will be set in the new board. the static board is the information from a diskFile or URL. overrides the method from board to fit the dynamic board
        Overrides:
        setBoard in class Board
        Parameters:
        the - static 2d board

      • nextGeneration

        public void nextGeneration()
        this method updates the board by applying the GoL rules to the board. By using a temporary array that stores the previous state of the board, the next generation of the board is created. overrides the method in Board to fit the dynamic board
        Overrides:
        nextGeneration in class Board

      • nextGenerationConcurrent

        public void nextGenerationConcurrent()
        this method splits the nextGeneration method into several tasks that are given to multiple threads, optimalize the performance. (due to a lack of time we couldn't finish implementing threads.)

      • nextGenerationConcurrentPrintPerformance

        public void nextGenerationConcurrentPrintPerformance()
        this method prints out the performance of the nextGeneration(); method. (due to a lack of time we couldn't finish implementing threads.)

      • neighbours

        public int neighbours(int x,
                      int y)
        This method counts the number of neighbouring cells a given cell has, by iterating through the board with two for-loops that only checks the 8 cells surrounding it. overrides the method in Board to fit the dynamic board
        Overrides:
        neighbours in class Board
        Parameters:
        the - x and y coordinates of the cell (placement of the cell in the grid)
        Returns:
        the number of neighbours the cell has.

      • updateBoard

        public void updateBoard(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Byte>> updated)
        This method updates the board by applying the GoL rules, by iterating through the board with two for-loops and assigning 1 or 0 using the GoL rules.
        Parameters:
        the - ArrayList which contains the previous generation

      • checkExpand

        public void checkExpand(int x,
                        int y)
        this method checks if its necessary to expand the board by checking the given cell. if it is, it expands the board by calling on two other methods (due to a lack of time we couldn't finish making the board dynamic.)
        Parameters:
        the - coordinates for the cell

      • expandBelow

        public void expandBelow(int i,
                        int j)
        this method expands the board with two cells south-east from the given cell point. (due to a lack of time we couldn't finish making the board dynamic.)
        Parameters:
        the - coordinates for the cell.

      • expandUpper

        public void expandUpper(int i,
                        int j)
        this method expands the board with two cells north-west from the given cell point (due to a lack of time we couldn't finish making the board dynamic.)
        Parameters:
        the - coordinates for the cell.

      • expandBehind

        public void expandBehind(int x,
                         int y)
        this method expands the dynamic board by adding cells behind the given cell (due to a lack of time we couldn't finish making the board dynamic.)
        Parameters:
        x - y coordinates to the cell
